title: KAPy derived variables configuration
description: Configuration of derived variables is set through a tab-separated table, with one row per variable. Note that the same schema is used for secondary and tertiary varibles - the main difference is the order in which they processed (primary, secondary, bias-adjustment, tertiary). Note also new variables declared here can refer to other derived variables, as along as they have already been declared higher up in the configuration table. All options are required

id.description: Code by which to refer to the variable e.g. tas, SPI, pr etc

inputVars.description: Comma-separated list of input variables to be used in generating this new variable.

outputVars.description: Comma-separated list of output variables generated by the script. Some functions generate more than one variable at a time e.g. FWI and this is where they should be listed. Currently limited to one.

processorType.description: What sort of processor will be used to calculate the new variable. Functions can be taken from an installed python module `module` or a python `script` containing a function

processorPath.description: The path to the processor. When `srcType` is `module`, the name of the module - otherwise the path to the python `script` containing the function to be used, relative to the working directory

processorFunction.description: The name of the function to be used to calculate the new variable

passXarrays.description: Should KAPy pass xArray objects to the function? If no, then then path to the input file is passed as a string instead.

additionalArgs.description: Additional arbitrary arguments specified as a dict to be passed to the function via keyword arguments. e.g. `{'param1':10,'doSim':true,'name':'myname'}. Can be an empty dict if no there are no additional parameters. e.g. `{}` `
